title: Why Britain desperately needs eight new 'gigafactories' to save its car industry
text:
In part 3 of our week-long series we look how EV battery production will be integral to the UK's economic prospects. Part 1 asked if the world was ready for EVs while part 2 looked at the battle to control rare earths.

Minutes after he entered Downing Street as Prime Minister for the first time, Boris Johnson made a point of singling out one area where British scientists were, in his words, “leading the world”: electric vehicle batteries.
